prompt:
Create 4 prompts for a cohesive, chronologically flowing thank-you greeting card that tells a visual story (9:16 ratio):

üé® CREATIVITY MANDATE: Be genuinely creative, unique, and innovative! Avoid generic or clich√© designs. Think outside the box, surprise with unexpected elements, use bold artistic choices, and create something truly memorable and special. Push creative boundaries while staying appropriate for the card type and tone.

Theme: "Thank you for attending, thank you for helping prosper thought. include a nice quote in left interior. front Cover:  include Ari Tal clearly and mention ‚ÄúAI For Good Conference Stanford CA June 2025‚Äù don‚Äôt include stanford logo just the campus. make the artwork in general beautiful, charming, but also appropriately professional. in front cover have scene be on stanford campus and include cute cartoon green dinosaur holding a greeting card with a heart. don‚Äôt draw any people. use light color theme. make sure any text is not close to borders."
Style: ‚ú® Smart Style
Tone: üòÑ Funny - humorous and lighthearted
To: Ari Tal
From: vibecarding.com
Message: "Left Interior:
"The human brain is a wonderful organ. It starts working the moment you get up in the morning and does not stop until you get into the office." - Robert Frost

Right Interior:
Hi Ari Tal,

Thank you for bringing your brilliant brain to the conference! We're pretty sure the collective brainpower in that room could have powered a small city (or at least taught our dinosaur mascot to file taxes). Your presence and thoughts made the whole event smarter and way more fun.

Gratefully,
The team at vibecarding.com"



CRITICAL: Create a cohesive visual narrative that flows chronologically through the card experience:
1. FRONT COVER: First impression - sets the scene/introduces the story
2. INTERIOR SPREAD: The heart of the experience - continuation and climax of the visual story
3. BACK COVER: Conclusion - peaceful resolution or complementary ending

Requirements:
- Flat 2D artwork for printing (not 3D card images)
- Full-bleed backgrounds extending to edges
- IMPORTANT: Keep text, faces, and key elements at least 10% away from top/bottom edges (small amount may be cropped in printing)
- Keep text/faces 0.5" from left/right edges for safe printing
- CONSISTENT visual elements throughout: same characters, color palette, lighting, art style
- Progressive visual storytelling from front ‚Üí interior ‚Üí back
- Put any text in quotes and make it clear/readable
- Each section should feel like part of the same artistic universe
- TONE: Ensure the visual mood and atmosphere matches the humorous and lighthearted tone throughout all sections
- INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY SAFETY: If the user mentions specific characters, brands, logos, or products, automatically replace them with original generic alternatives in your prompts. For example: replace specific character names with "cartoon mouse character" or "superhero character", replace brand names with "colorful cereal" or "sports car", etc. Create inspired-by designs that capture the essence without referencing any protected names or specific copyrighted elements. Never include actual brand names, character names, or trademarked terms in the image generation prompts
- CONTENT SAFETY: Ensure all prompts are family-friendly and appropriate for greeting cards. Avoid any content that could be flagged by safety systems including: violence, weapons, inappropriate imagery, political content, controversial topics, scary or disturbing elements, or anything not suitable for all ages. If the user requests something potentially inappropriate, redirect to positive, wholesome alternatives that capture their intent in a family-friendly way
- Include visual humor, playful elements, and whimsical details







Create prompts that flow chronologically:

1. Front Cover (Opening Scene): BE GENUINELY CREATIVE AND UNIQUE! Include "thank-you" greeting text positioned safely in the center area (avoid top/bottom 10% of image). TEXT STYLE: Write the greeting text in beautiful, clearly readable handwritten cursive script that matches the elegant style used inside the card - legible, flowing, and graceful with natural character and warmth. Create charming cartoon-style or stylized illustrated figures if people are needed for the theme. This is the story opening - introduce key visual elements (colors, motifs, artistic style) that will continue throughout the other sections. Think of something unexpected, innovative, and memorable that will surprise and delight the recipient. Avoid generic designs! Style: in a whimsical and charming soft watercolor style. The scene on the Stanford campus will be rendered with a light, airy touch, using a warm and inviting palette of pastel greens, gentle stone beiges, and soft sky blues. The architectural details of the campus buildings are suggested with delicate, flowing lines and gentle washes of color, creating a dreamy, picturesque backdrop that feels both recognizable and artistically rendered. The star of the scene, a cute cartoon green dinosaur, will be painted with soft edges and a friendly, endearing expression, holding a tiny greeting card. The overall effect is one of handcrafted warmth and thoughtful appreciation, combining professional elegance with a touch of playful, heartfelt charm that is sure to make the recipient smile.

2. Left Interior (Story Development): UNLEASH YOUR CREATIVITY! You have complete creative freedom to design whatever you want for this left interior page! This is your artistic playground - create something genuinely innovative and unexpected that feels right for a thank-you card with humorous and lighthearted tone. You can include: scenes, landscapes, objects, patterns, quotes, text, illustrations, realistic art, abstract art, or anything else that inspires you - but NO PEOPLE or characters unless the user specifically mentioned wanting people in their card description. Position any text safely in center area (avoid top/bottom 10%). Think of something no one has done before! Surprise us with bold, imaginative, and memorable artistic choices while maintaining visual harmony with the overall card style and tone. Style: in a whimsical and charming soft watercolor style. The scene on the Stanford campus will be rendered with a light, airy touch, using a warm and inviting palette of pastel greens, gentle stone beiges, and soft sky blues. The architectural details of the campus buildings are suggested with delicate, flowing lines and gentle washes of color, creating a dreamy, picturesque backdrop that feels both recognizable and artistically rendered. The star of the scene, a cute cartoon green dinosaur, will be painted with soft edges and a friendly, endearing expression, holding a tiny greeting card. The overall effect is one of handcrafted warmth and thoughtful appreciation, combining professional elegance with a touch of playful, heartfelt charm that is sure to make the recipient smile.

3. Right Interior (Story Climax): BE CREATIVE WITH MESSAGE DESIGN! Include message text: "Left Interior:
"The human brain is a wonderful organ. It starts working the moment you get up in the morning and does not stop until you get into the office." - Robert Frost

Right Interior:
Hi Ari Tal,

Thank you for bringing your brilliant brain to the conference! We're pretty sure the collective brainpower in that room could have powered a small city (or at least taught our dinosaur mascot to file taxes). Your presence and thoughts made the whole event smarter and way more fun.

Gratefully,
The team at vibecarding.com" positioned safely in center area (avoid top/bottom 10% of image) integrated into beautiful, innovative decorative artwork. HANDWRITING STYLE: Write the message in beautiful, clearly readable handwritten cursive script that feels elegant and personal. The handwriting should be legible, flowing, and have natural character - not overly perfect but graceful and warm. Use a nice pen-style appearance with natural ink flow and slight variations in line weight. Think of sophisticated calligraphy that's still approachable and easy to read. Make the handwriting feel genuine and heartfelt. Think beyond typical florals and patterns - create something unexpected and artistic that perfectly frames the handwritten message - NO PEOPLE or characters. This should feel like the emotional peak of the card experience, harmonizing with the left interior as a cohesive spread. Avoid clich√© designs and create something genuinely special! Use the elegant cursive handwriting style described above. Style: in a whimsical and charming soft watercolor style. The scene on the Stanford campus will be rendered with a light, airy touch, using a warm and inviting palette of pastel greens, gentle stone beiges, and soft sky blues. The architectural details of the campus buildings are suggested with delicate, flowing lines and gentle washes of color, creating a dreamy, picturesque backdrop that feels both recognizable and artistically rendered. The star of the scene, a cute cartoon green dinosaur, will be painted with soft edges and a friendly, endearing expression, holding a tiny greeting card. The overall effect is one of handcrafted warmth and thoughtful appreciation, combining professional elegance with a touch of playful, heartfelt charm that is sure to make the recipient smile.

4. Back Cover (Story Resolution): BE SUBTLY CREATIVE! Create a simple yet innovative decorative design that brings peaceful closure to the visual story. Reference subtle elements from the front cover but keep it minimal and serene - NO PEOPLE, just beautiful, unexpected artistic elements that go beyond typical patterns or florals. IMPORTANT: Leave the bottom-right corner area (approximately 1 inch square) completely clear and undecorated - this space is reserved for a QR code. Focus decorative elements toward the center and left side of the design. Think of something quietly beautiful and memorable that complements the overall design while being genuinely unique. This should feel like a peaceful, artistic ending that surprises with its subtle creativity. Style: in a whimsical and charming soft watercolor style. The scene on the Stanford campus will be rendered with a light, airy touch, using a warm and inviting palette of pastel greens, gentle stone beiges, and soft sky blues. The architectural details of the campus buildings are suggested with delicate, flowing lines and gentle washes of color, creating a dreamy, picturesque backdrop that feels both recognizable and artistically rendered. The star of the scene, a cute cartoon green dinosaur, will be painted with soft edges and a friendly, endearing expression, holding a tiny greeting card. The overall effect is one of handcrafted warmth and thoughtful appreciation, combining professional elegance with a touch of playful, heartfelt charm that is sure to make the recipient smile.

VISUAL CONTINUITY CHECKLIST:
- Same color palette across all sections
- Consistent lighting/time of day
- Same artistic techniques and brushwork
- Recurring visual motifs or symbols (but make them unique and memorable!)
- Progressive emotional journey from introduction to resolution
- Front cover: stylized cartoon/illustrated characters if people are needed for the theme
- Left interior: CREATIVE FREEDOM but NO PEOPLE unless user specifically requested people in their description
- Right interior: focus on message space with innovative decorative elements (NO PEOPLE)
- Back cover: simple yet creative decorative design without text or people
- Use simplified, friendly, charming character design if including people (front cover only)
- CREATIVITY PRIORITY: Always choose the more innovative, surprising, and memorable option over generic designs

Return JSON:
{
  "frontCover": "detailed prompt with story opening elements",
  "backCover": "detailed prompt with story conclusion elements",
  "leftInterior": "detailed prompt with story development elements",
  "rightInterior": "detailed prompt with story climax elements"
}

IMPORTANT: Create a completely unique and different interpretation for this specific card variant. Use different creative approaches, color schemes, compositions, and artistic elements while maintaining the same core theme and requirements.

generatedPrompts.backCover: Back cover design for a thank-you greeting card with a whimsical and charming soft watercolor style. The background is a very light, creamy off-white, subtly textured like watercolor paper. In the lower left corner, a portion of a cute, stylized cartoon green dinosaur's tail is visible, curving upwards and to the right with a gentle, soft edge. The tail is painted with varying shades of light green, suggesting a rounded form and dotted with a few lighter green oval spots. Scattered in the upper right quadrant of the cover are a few soft, abstract watercolor splotches in muted pastel tones: a pale mint green, a soft peachy-orange, and a very light dusty blue. These splotches are diffused and airy, creating a sense of gentle movement and playful, ethereal decoration. The overall composition is minimalist and serene, designed to provide a peaceful conclusion to the card's visual narrative. The bottom-right corner is intentionally left completely clear to accommodate a QR code, with no decorative elements encroaching on this space. The artistic style is consistent with a light, airy touch, using a warm and inviting palette of pastel greens, gentle stone beiges, and soft sky blues, maintaining the overall handcrafted warmth and thoughtful appreciation of the card.
generatedPrompts.leftInterior:
Left interior page of a greeting card with a whimsical, soft watercolor style. The overall composition depicts a stylized representation of a human brain, rendered in muted blues and greens with subtle watercolor washes. The brain's shape is clearly outlined, with internal divisions resembling neural pathways, all done in a light, airy watercolor technique.

The central focus is the quote: "The human brain is a wonderful organ. It starts working the moment you get up in the morning and does not stop until you get into the office. - Robert Frost". The quote is written in a beautiful, flowing, handwritten cursive script in a dark teal color, with natural variations in ink flow and line weight, giving it an elegant yet approachable feel.

Scattered within the brain's "lobes" are various playful, illustrative elements, each depicted with the same soft watercolor style and color palette:
- In the upper left quadrant, "SNACK STORAGE" is written in a simple, sans-serif font in dark teal. Below it, a small, orange chicken drumstick with a green leaf accent is drawn, suggesting stored sustenance.
- To the left of the main quote, "DAPPER TIE SELECTION" is written in a similar sans-serif font. Below this text is a small, orange, patterned tie with a subtle yellow diamond pattern.
- To the right of the main quote, a small stack of two books is depicted in muted orange and green, with the text "ADVANCED CALCULUS (for taxes)" written in a clear, dark teal sans-serif font below them.
- Several small, stylized gears in a warm orange hue are placed strategically within the brain's structure, symbolizing the workings of the mind.
- Around the periphery of the brain illustration, three glowing lightbulbs are depicted in a soft yellow and blue watercolor style, symbolizing ideas and inspiration.

The background is a soft, creamy beige, enhancing the light and airy feel of the watercolor art. The overall aesthetic is charming, intellectual, and lighthearted, perfectly capturing the humorous tone intended for the card. All elements are thoughtfully placed within the brain's outline, creating a cohesive and visually interesting composition.
generatedPrompts.rightInterior: Right interior page of a greeting card designed for message space with a charming, lighthearted, and humorous tone. The artwork is in a soft watercolor style, featuring a pale yellow textured background. The left side of the page is dedicated to the handwritten message, presented in an elegant, flowing, dark brown cursive script that conveys warmth and personality. The text is neatly arranged, with ample spacing between lines to ensure readability. Positioned to the right of the text is a whimsical illustration. This illustration features a stack of colorful, vertically oriented books in shades of red, blue, green, and yellow, rendered with soft watercolor textures. Perched atop the books is a cute, friendly cartoon green dinosaur, looking curious and engaged. Capping the stack of books is a single, open book, and balanced on top of that is a glowing, warm yellow lightbulb, symbolizing ideas and intelligence. The overall composition is balanced, with the text occupying the majority of the left space and the illustration providing a visually appealing and thematic element on the right, creating a harmonious and engaging layout for the message.
